page.title: 03ETON
page.content: Like the neighbouring village of Datchet ,Eton grew up on the only part of the land above the usual level of the river Thames .Travellers from Windsor Castle going to the north made regular use of the High Street, Inns and shops grew up to cater for their needs. The founding of Eton College provided the village with a permanent patron and customer. The village has always been liable to flooding and there were severe floods in 1894 and 1947.The older parts of the village then revealed themselves as small islands standing above the river.Large and decorative boot-scrapers outside many of the older houses testify to the muddy nature of the area.
